thread.title: Pogba thanks Man Utd superfan who regularly makes 18,000-mile round journey to Old Trafford
thread.title_full: Pogba thanks Man Utd superfan who regularly makes 18,000-mile round journey to Old Trafford

title: Pogba thanks Man Utd superfan who regularly makes 18,000-mile round journey to Old Trafford
text:
0 09-Jan-2017 16:02:36 The France international has shown his gratitude to a supporter who often travels halfway around the world to watch the Red Devils in action 
Manchester United’s global appeal is beyond question, with the Red Devils having become of the biggest brands on the planet. 
Neymar & Pogba OUT of FIFA World 11 
The Old Trafford outfit recently topped a poll run by Goal to find the world’s most popular club, with Jose Mourinho’s men collecting 23 per cent of the vote. 
Their attraction is obvious, as 20-time winners of the English top-flight title – with 13 of those successes coming during the Premier League era. 
They also boast some of the finest talent in the global game, and have done for many years. 
It should therefore come as no surprise to find that some supporters go to great lengths to watch United in action. 
Some even travel halfway around the world to catch a glimpse of their heroes, with Paul Pogba recently catching up with a globe-trekking follower from Australia. A photo posted by Paul Labile Pogba (@paulpogba) on Jan 8, 2017 at 2:39am PST 
That is some commitment to the Red Devils cause, with an 18,000-mile round journey made on a regular basis. 
United have at least been offering something for their fanatical support to get excited about of late, with Mourinho’s men having won eight successive games in all competitions and gone unbeaten since November 3. Related
